programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Liam and Ben attempt to catch a gang of late-night burglars, but one of the suspects treats an officer to a face full of saliva, while Jacko and Simon are in pursuit of a car round the streets of Ferryhill, but it's not the interceptors who make the arrest. Meanwhile, Spike tails two suspected burglars in an unmarked car before making a back-street stop and Liam's sniffer dog Louie uncovers large amounts of cash and drugs following an armed raid

programme.title: Flaming Star (1960)
programme.desc: The son of a Native American mother and a white father faces a test of loyalties when he is caught on the racial divide as a Kiowa tribe go on the warpath and white settlers carry out brutal reprisal attacks. Whereas he is drawn to side with his mother's people, his half-brother takes the opposing view. Western, starring Elvis Presley, Steve Forrest, Barbara Eden, Richard Jaeckel and Dolores Del Rio

programme.title: Flame of the Barbary Coast (1945)
programme.desc: A cattle rancher falls for a San Francisco saloon-bar singer, but she proves to be in cahoots with a ruthless card sharp who wins all his money. Not to be outdone, he sets out to hone his card-playing skills for a rematch, unaware the city is poised on the brink of disaster. Romantic drama, starring John Wayne, Ann Dvorak and Joseph Schildkraut

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Chris Spencer and the team chase a Golf GTI racing through the streets at three times the speed limit, while reports of gunshots at a house party on a residential street lead to a full-scale firearms operation
S15E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dog handler Steve and the firearms team are involved in a dramatic doorstep showdown in which a man is alleged to have attacked someone with an axe and a machete. A stolen van makes off from officers in Leeds before nearly hitting a dog walker, while a tactical pursuit and containment collars a disqualified driver who tries to pull the wool over the interceptors' eyes
S15E04

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
In North Yorkshire, officers are out in force protecting lorry drivers and their cargoes as organised gangs target goods and trucks travelling through the county. Near York, when a suspicious empty lorry is spotted on an industrial estate, police believe it's being used to transport stolen goods from another vehicle. On the outskirts of Leeds, a police helicopter is called in to help search for suspected fuel thieves hiding out in the woods after fleeing from an abandoned stolen car packed with more than 20 empty barrels ready to be filled with diesel
S12E09

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Concerned 999 callers report an HGV swerving all over the M6, so PCs Jamie Barlow and Amy Hollis team up to search for the vehicle in question. When they finally catch up with the driver, they discover the awful truth behind his dangerous driving. On the M56, two trucks have collided near Cheshire Oaks, with reports that one of the drivers may have suffered a heart attack, so Inspector Anton Sullivan races to the scene of the crash to find out exactly what happened
S03E08

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc:
A South Wales officer is bitten on the finger while trying to make an arrest, while new policewoman finds herself separated from her colleague and facing an angry young man - who decides to attack her. In south London, two Metropolitan Police officers respond to a 999 call and PC Gray climbs into a dark room through a broken window and soon finds himself facing a man who is armed with a shovel
S03E05

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A violent man gives officers the runaround after wreaking havoc in a hospital, a Macedonian truck driver has a bad day and a fuel thief is caught red-handed. Meanwhile, two Audi S3s are put through their paces by the team and the Operational Support Unit goes back to the classroom for a course about dealing with riots
S06E07

programme.title: UK's Strongest Man
programme.desc:
UK's Strongest Man 2022: The Final: Action from the final of the event at Stadium MK in Milton Keynes, where Gavin Bilton was the defending champion. The gruelling disciplines taking places were the Truck Pull, Sack Shouldering, Squat, Block Press Medley and Giant Flag Hoist
S2022E05

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Crimes of Greed: Police use CCTV footage to track down a gang who murdered a restaurant owner, and a heartless criminal is caught on camera robbing a pensioner
S05E10

programme.title: Doomsday: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Rivers of Lava and More: Two families in the Bahamas try to survive one of the strongest hurricanes on record, as rivers of scorching lava wipe out everything in their path, and a terrifying twister threatens an entire town and thousands of innocent people
S01E03

programme.title: Concorde: 120 Seconds to Disaster
programme.desc: Detailing the events of 25 July, 2000, when Air France Flight 4590 crashed shortly after taking off from Charles de Gaulle Airport, Paris, resulting in the deaths of 113 people. Most of the wreckage was consumed by fire, but three mysterious clues were found on the runway - a ruptured fuel tank, some torn pieces of tyre, and a mysterious strip of metal. This documentary made almost 20 years after the event reveals how French investigators used this curious collection of clues to determine the cause. This was the first-ever fatal accident involving a Concorde, the world's only supersonic passenger airliner, but nevertheless led to an immediate cessation of the aircraft's use and ultimately contributed to its withdrawal from service almost four years later

programme.title: Red Shoe Diaries
programme.desc:
Midnight Bells: Claire is unable to forget the man she let get away after three New Year's Eves spent together, but on the next one she seeks the man of her dreams. Drama, starring Charlotte Lewis

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Rookie team member Rachael faces a baptism of fire on a night shift, from a face-off with a driver threatening her colleague Lee's family, to the pursuit of a high-speed Mercedes carrying with a pregnant passenger. Elsewhere, Liam plays a pitch-black game of hunt the knife in the aftermath of a terrifying armed robbery, dog handler Mo deals with a double fire before arresting a man who appears to be stealing from a phone box, and a motorist picks up the phone and calls the police to report interceptor Chris for stealing his car
S14E05

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A failure to stop in Hartlepool turns into an armed stand-off and a full-blown kidnapping situation, while a 14-year-old boy is found in possession of a bag of crack cocaine, cash and a knife. Lee goes on a high-speed pursuit through Stockton, and Jacko and Simon tackle a drug driver who is wearing a balaclava
S14E06

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
During a dramatic pursuit, Faulko is rammed off the road at 80mph and has to be rushed to hospital, while the team battles to tackle the aftermath of the crash, and track down the driver responsible. Meanwhile, timing is everything as Liam locks up a rogue biker with the help of patience, pepper spray and the actions of a heroic passer-by
S14E08

programme.title: Daylight (1996)
programme.desc: A devastating explosion in the New Jersey Tunnel causes a horrific pile-up, trapping a group of motorists underground. A former emergency worker witnesses the blast and heads in to guide the handful of survivors to safety before the waters of the Hudson river above them break through and flood the tunnel. Disaster movie, starring Sylvester Stallone, Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Dan Hedaya and Claire Bloom

programme.desc: Bandits invade a frontier town, rob the bank, kill the sheriff and kidnap a local woman. Western, starring Audie Murphy, John Saxon, Vic Morrow and Lee Van Cleef

programme.title: The Jumbo Jet: 50 Years in the Sky
programme.desc:
How They Built the Jumbo Jet: Documentary celebrating the Boeing 747 and examines the lasting impact of 'the plane that shrank the world'. The first of two episodes explores the story behind the 747's design, revealing some of the challenges faced during its initial construction. The project very nearly led Boeing into bankruptcy, as they raced to meet an ambitious delivery deadline
S01E01

programme.title: The Jumbo Jet: 50 Years in the Sky
programme.desc:
How They Built the Jumbo Jet: The concluding part of the documentary celebrating the Boeing 747 looks at the social history of the airliner's working life, from its first commercial flight in 1970 up to the present day. The programme examines the part it played in democratising air travel and creating long-haul for all, taking a nostalgic journey from the glamorous age of the jet set to the no-frills air travel of today
S01E02

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Documentary showing how CCTV and other technological advances are helping to bring car thieves to justice. Suspected criminals in Chester are involved in a high-speed chase through the city centre, and there is footage that helped put an end to one of London's most prolific gangs. The programme also includes film of a getaway in which robbers tried to evade the law by driving at 180mph
S01E04

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Yorkshire police forces tackling an ever-more sophisticated criminal fraternity from the cities to the Dales. programme.title: Warship: Life at Sea
programme.desc:
HMS Northumberland is ordered to investigate when Navy Command sends news about a gathering of Russian warships and submarines off the coast of Ireland. The timely arrival of ship's new chaplain coincides with a growing problem of decreasing morale, brought on as a result of the crew's inability to take time off. As HMS Northumberland leaves port, the chaplain tries to help the crew through another challenging mission
S03E04

Barry Peach outsmarts a disqualified driver, handler Jon Peacock takes his new sniffer dog Jack to carry out a drugs warrant, Carl Warrener makes a jaw-dropping discovery when he pulls a car over in the early hours and Brian Conville gets mobbed when he deals with a reckless learner driver
S08E01

programme.title: Fights, Camera, Action!
programme.desc:
Hell on Wheels: Clip show of dramatic confrontations filmed by eye-witnesses, presented by George Lamb. This episode looks at rage on two wheels - hostile and aggressive encounters between bicyclists or motorcyclists and cars, pedestrians, thieves, and of course other bikers
S01E01

programme.title: Doomsday: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
A Tornado of Bats and More: A father-and-son camping trip turns into a battle against a raging wildfire in an intense race to survive. A towering avalanche on Mount Everest blindsides climbers
S01E04

programme.title: Red Arrows: Kings of the Sky
programme.desc:
The story of the famous squadron as it creates a new jaw-dropping display and embarks on a challenging worldwide season, showcasing the work of the ground crews and backroom staff who make it all possible. A new team leader comes on board, whose job it is to design and develop fresh and ambitious manoeuvres for the 2018 season, marking the RAF's 100th anniversary
S01E01

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Steve faces a malfunctioning clutch while preparing for a gruelling trip, and Robbie and his crew embark on a challenging trip moving a timber house
S03E03

programme.title: Broken Arrow (1950)
programme.desc: A former Union scout is befriended by famed chief Cochise after he saves the life of a native boy. Having witnessed 10 years of conflict between Apaches and advancing settlers, the veteran soldier seizes the fleeting chance to broker a ceasefire between the two sides. Western, starring James Stewart, Jeff Chandler, Debra Paget and Basil Ruysdael

programme.title: Young Guns of Texas (1962)
programme.desc: A disgraced military cadet goes in search of the thieves who stole an army payroll. He is soon joined by three other men after the reward money, but they are pursued in turn by an angry rancher after one of them elopes with his daughter. As the three groups catch up with each other, they all face a common threat in a band of hostile Apaches. Western, starring James Mitchum and Alana Ladd

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Young Guns of Texas (1962)
programme.desc: A disgraced military cadet goes in search of the thieves who stole an army payroll. He is soon joined by three other men after the reward money, but they are pursued in turn by an angry rancher after one of them elopes with his daughter. As the three groups catch up with each other, they all face a common threat in a band of hostile Apaches. Western, starring James Mitchum and Alana Ladd

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc:
Deer Horn Knives: After two turbulent nautically themed rounds, two bladesmiths head the final round to forge the Kachin Dao, a deadly headhunting sword
S04E02

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
West Yorkshire officers take action against a teenage driver after he leads them on a high-speed chase across Roundhay Park in Leeds, while the cops also face a battle to keep up with uninsured drivers who flout the law without fear of consequence
S01E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers swoop on a housing estate searching for suspects involved in a shooting and it needs to be a tightly controlled operation and communication is key between the firearms unit, police helicopters and dog handler Duncan. Elsewhere, Steve responds to reports of a burglary in progress, and ends up on a chase through back gardens. After catching one of the suspects, Steve receives a shock when he returns to check out the burgled house
S15E07

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Steve is involved in a dangerous high-speed pursuit of a car stolen in a burglary. The fleeing driver ditches and runs, but will the police chopper be able to keep him in their sights? Claire and Tom deal with an abusive drunk driver who is clueless about what he has done wrong, rookie Omar tackles a fence-hopping suspect whose antics have left him with a slashed hand, and Steve tracks down a car suspected of being involved in a robbery
S15E08

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dog handler Duncan attends a midnight stand-off between armed officers and a man who has been seen carrying knives, Suggs pulls over a motorist who appears incapable of telling the truth, and Charlie is given the unenviable task of removing a Range Rover from a ditch after a crash
S15E09

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Andy Doran chases thieves on the run from a shop robbery in Ellesmere Port, where they have reportedly stolen thousands of pounds worth of goods. When the suspect vehicle is finally spotted 70 miles from the crime scene on the M6, Andy and two other patrols must be quick to stop the criminals before they get away
S03E09

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc:
A distressed man calls in to report that his neighbour is acting aggressively in the street outside his home, and police arrive to find a heavily intoxicated male who refuses to co-operate. The situation takes an ugly turn when the suspect physically resists arrest and attempts to bite an officer, and when the police do a quick check of their records, they discover that the man is wanted for far more than a breach of the peace
S03E06

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The Operational Support Unit has to evade a guard dog when carrying out a drugs raid on a farm, while a driver thinks he can pull a fast one by impersonating his brother. Barry finds himself dealing with an irate nightclubber, Craggy has an early morning encounter with a polecat and it is a case of deja vu for Dan as he deals with the same person twice in one shift
S06E09

programme.title: Doomsday: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Mudslide of Mayhem and More: A team of veteran firefighters become trapped inside their truck during a raging wildfire. A mother tries to escape from an erupting volcano
S01E05

programme.title: Red Arrows: Kings of the Sky
programme.desc:
The Red Arrows: A Year in the Sky: Two pilots from the famous squadron attempt a series of hair-raising manoeuvres for the first time as the team begin their intense winter training ahead of the RAF centenary celebrations. This episode also takes a look behind the breathtaking action, and follows the efforts of the ground teams as they practice, plan and prepare for the shows
S01E02

programme.title: Damn the Defiant! (1962)
programme.desc: The commander of a British warship fighting in the Napoleonic campaign faces bitter opposition from his right-hand man, a cruel and sadistic officer hated by the crew. In a battle of wills between the pair, the captain's second-in-command tries to provoke his leader's wrath by tormenting his son, an officer on the vessel. Drama, starring Alec Guinness, Dirk Bogarde and Anthony Quayle

programme.desc: The commander of a British warship fighting in the Napoleonic campaign faces bitter opposition from his right-hand man, a cruel and sadistic officer hated by the crew. programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Flaming Star (1960)
programme.desc: The son of a Native American mother and a white father faces a test of loyalties when he is caught on the racial divide as a Kiowa tribe go on the warpath and white settlers carry out brutal reprisal attacks. Whereas he is drawn to side with his mother's people, his half-brother takes the opposing view. Western, starring Elvis Presley, Steve Forrest, Barbara Eden, Richard Jaeckel and Dolores Del Rio

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc:
The Katzbalger: Four competitors look to secure a place in the final where they will be tasked with forging intricate Renaissance side-arm, the Katzbalger
S04E03

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
The officers deal with a number of uninsured drivers, including one who leads them on a 35-minute chase and another who flees the scene of a rush-hour crash, earning himself a full-scale investigation for his trouble. Then in Bradford, a crackdown on road offences leads to the officers nabbing another insurance avoider, but tensions run high as a result
S01E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Charlie and Wayne are in hot pursuit of a van, but the driver crashes the vehicle and runs off into the night. With the help of a tracker, officers hunt down a 17-year-old suspected of committing a serious robbery, while Matt and Brimmers are on the hunt for the driver of a 300,000 Rolls-Royce who is thought to be under the influence
S15E10

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A high-powered Porsche is pursued by eight police cars and a helicopter, while Officers Ben P and Ben B attend a crash scene where a car has flipped over and landed on its roof, and their difficult job is made harder by a crowd filming the aftermath of the accident on their phones
S16E01

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
In North Yorkshire, officers are out in force protecting lorry drivers and their cargoes as organised gangs target goods and trucks travelling through the county. Near York, when a suspicious empty lorry is spotted on an industrial estate, police believe it's being used to transport stolen goods from another vehicle. On the outskirts of Leeds, a police helicopter is called in to help search for suspected fuel thieves hiding out in the woods after fleeing from an abandoned stolen car packed with more than 20 empty barrels ready to be filled with diesel
S12E09

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds (2000)
programme.desc: A veteran car thief is forced out of retirement to steal 50 top-of-the-range vehicles in exchange for his brother's life. While his sibling is held hostage by a sadistic gangster, he asks his former cronies to help - but with the clock ticking and just a few days remaining to pull off the daunting task, their chances of success are hanging by a thread. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Sabotage (2014)
programme.desc: The members of an elite Drug Enforcement Administration team secretly keep the millions of dollars they find during the raid. When they are killed off one by one, the leader becomes convinced one of his men is getting rid of the others to keep all the money, and sets out to expose the murderer. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sam Worthington

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.desc:

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:

In Hammersmith, west London, camera operators help police as they try to enforce a drinking ban on a local park and spot a group whose members may be about to break into a shop
S01E05

programme.title: Flame of the Barbary Coast (1945)
programme.desc: A cattle rancher falls for a San Francisco saloon-bar singer, but she proves to be in cahoots with a ruthless card sharp who wins all his money. Not to be outdone, he sets out to hone his card-playing skills for a rematch, unaware the city is poised on the brink of disaster. Romantic drama, starring John Wayne, Ann Dvorak and Joseph Schildkraut

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Westbound (1959)
programme.desc: A former Union soldier is employed by a stagecoach company to guard a large gold shipment being transported across the country. Meanwhile, a loyal follower of the defeated Confederacy is plotting to steal the bullion to revive the cause, but his plans are confounded by traitorous henchmen and his wife, who was once the lover of the Union veteran. Western, with Randolph Scott, Andrew Duggan and Virginia Mayo

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc:
Makraka: Four bladesmiths forge a curved knife that resembles a claw, and the final two competitors have five days to create one of the deadliest weapons in African history, the Makraka
S04E04

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
It is estimated that more than a million vehicles in Britain are fitted with cloned number plates as criminals who switch them to pass by police cameras undetected. On the outskirts of Bradford, a suspected stolen car using cloned plates crashes after running a red light, leaving the occupants of another car with serious injuries, leaving officers to deal with the aftermath, while a manhunt is launched for the offenders
S01E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Pursued by a helicopter and a team of armed response vehicles, two men armed with machetes and a sawn-off shotgun make a dramatic escape on a motorbike. Meanwhile, officers Clarkie and Nick take two dangerous boy racers off the road, and a high-speed pursuit of alleged burglars turns into a race on foot
S16E02

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Return of the programme following Cheshire Police's elite team of officers as they crack down on some of Britain's most serious driving offenders. PCs Ian Cosgrove and Rich Woodward attend the scene of a shocking multi-vehicle crash on the M56 that has left a woman trapped in a car, while Inspector Anton Sullivan enlists the help of PCs Niaz Waddington and Amy Hollis to pull a stolen car over. Nick Campbell narrates
S02E01

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A suspect assaults Steve with his car keys, leaving the officer in need of urgent medical attention, while Charlie and Paul pursue a motorist who drove off from a garage without paying for fuel. Chris and Sophie spot a bunny-hopping learner driver who already has eight points on his provisional licence
S16E03

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:

programme.desc:

programme.desc:

S08E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 03/03/2023: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kimberley Walsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc:
A criminal couple use an unusual technique to con people at cashpoints. A would-be robber with a knife underestimates an older female cashier, and a bragging joyrider ends up crashing back down to earth. Presented by Dominic Littlewood
S11E10

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc:
CCTV shows what really happened when car passengers claim to be hurt badly after being hit by a bus, while a prisoner's bogus claim for an injury on a running machine is scuppered. Presented by Naga Munchetty
S12E05

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of holiday lets in Blackpool and Llanfynydd and a semi-detached house in Wolverhampton, finding out what the new owners have done with the properties
S25E48

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Leominster 3: Christina Trevanion is in Leominster, Herefordshire, where experts Tim Weeks and Kate Bliss help two teams search for antiques that they hope will make them a profit at auction
S57E05

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc:
The Wheels of Wrath: Rock 'n' roll reaches Kembleford when a group of bikers causes outrage and excitement in equal measure. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark
S10E09

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Cutdown: The Royal Cheshire County Show - Goats: Two hopeful goat farming couples, Sam and Jess from Sheffield and Mark and Graeme from Catterick, compete in an intense day of judging at the Royal Cheshire County Show

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Peak District: Sonali Shah embarks on a hunt for a rural home in the Derbyshire Peak District with a couple of soon-to-be retirees who have a budget of 500,000, and for whom a pond is a high priority. Away from the house hunt, Sonali gets battle ready when she meets a master armourer and his apprentice who are upholding the tradition of this metalwork craft
S19E22

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc:
Mark Hill buys a 1970s motorbike, has high hopes for a biscuit tin and sets his sights on auction glory with a stereoscopic viewer. Away from her purchasing, Irita Marriott takes a trip to an historic farm to find out why music played a key role in spreading the Salvation Army's message over the years. Later, the duo put friendship to one side as they enter the saleroom for a final time
S26E15

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc:
Intrepid team members Kyle, Sharna, Barbara and Shaun compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp
S01E05

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman
S27E41

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 03/03/2023: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Nish and Suki bless their marriage but she is distracted by paranoia about who heard her conversation with Eve. Much to Suki's horror, Eve attends the marriage blessing ceremony. Patrick and Vi are a success with the Walford Gazette but the reporter is so impressed that she insists on a follow up interview

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc:
Humphrey and Martha throw themselves into work in an attempt to distract themselves from recent events. For Humphrey, this means investigating one of the strangest cases he's ever encountered - an entire family has vanished, leaving their TV and lights on and dinner half-eaten. Martha prepares for the launch of her caf, but is thrown when a face from the past shows up. Death in Paradise spin-off, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton and featuring Ruth Madoc in one of her final TV roles
S01E02

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc:
Written in Murder: Famous thriller author Frank O'Toole is found stabbed through the heart after taking an early morning swim in the ocean. Suspicion soon falls on the victim's wife Valerie, but with eyewitnesses confirming he was swimming alone, how could anyone have got from the house to the sea without being detected? Away from the investigation, Dwayne concentrates on finding a date for a voodoo love festival. Whodunit, guest starring Simon Callow, Imogen Stubbs, and Sian Gibson of Car Share fame
S07E03

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc:
Compilation Show - 1: The first of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Taylor Swift, Daniel Craig, Eddie Redmayne, Lashana Lynch, Bono, Kate Hudson, Ian McKellen, Paul Mescal, Geena Davis, Stormzy, Lesley Manville, Colin Farrell and Bruce Springsteen
S30E20

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc:
The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Katherine Ryan, Harry Pinero, Rev Richard Coles, Scott Mills, Mark Wright, Judi Love and Philippa Perry
S03E08

programme.desc: Boston Celtics v Brooklyn Nets (Tip-off 12.30am). All the action from the Eastern Conference encounter at TD Garden

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: 04/03/2023: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Poppy O'Toole and Bryn Williams, plus special guest Alesha Dixon. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc:
Afternoon Tea: Nadiya Hussain provides the inspiration to bring the joy of baking into everyday lives, and celebrates bakers across Britain, shining a light on their favourite bakes. She begins with treats for an easy Afternoon Tea, from striped meringue lollipops to coffee cake with dalgona coffee cream and dreamy butterscotch cheesecake bars, and meets Mina Said-Allsopp, who shares her secrets to a gluten-free chocolate sourdough
S01E01

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Liverpool v Manchester United. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Manchester City and Newcastle United

programme.desc:

S53E09

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Wiltshire: Jonnie Irwin helps a couple from London with a 550,000 budget to make a rural move to Wiltshire, and joins a group of bicycling enthusiasts on a ride through Longleat Estate
S22E02

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the second session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The women's pole vault final gets under way and the men's heptathlon continues with the high jump. The women's 800m semi-finals also take place, with Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson the reigning champion. With analysis by Jessica Ennis-Hill and Denise Lewis, and commentary from Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc:
Clive Myrie hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Yvette Fielding, Helen McGinn, Matt Richardson and Sarah Keith-Lucas are in the famous black chair, answering questions on Morecambe & Wise, The Hollywood novels of Jackie Collins, Concorde, and the film Labyrinth
S20E08

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc:
Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees former England rugby star Ugo Monye, tennis player Judy Murray, goalkeeper David James and Scottish footballer Pat Nevin taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities
S01E05

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc:
The comedian returns with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Motsi Mabuse, Jon Richardson, Tom Skinner, Carol Vorderman, Joe Marler, Rav Wilding and Joanne McNally
S03E09

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc:
News: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman host a news-themed episode of the celebrity quiz. Cathy Newman, Keme Nzerem, Lucrezia Millarini, Nina Nannar, Mike Bushell, Kasia Madera, Jennie Bond, Nicholas Owen pair up to come up with the answers that no one else could think of
S15E16

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc:
Pushover: Jacob struggles to gain the respect he needs from his department, and feels that Robyn is not putting in the effort she needs to. Stevie is haunted by Marcus' abuse, but Faith helps her to both move forward and see that he suffers some consequences for his crimes. Rash is left struggling with his Dad's welfare after his carer is attacked
S37E21

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc:
Bust Up: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis
S09E07

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bournemouth at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens and Newcastle shared the spoils in a thrilling 3-3 draw at St James' Park in August, but the champions will have hoped to make home advantage count this time around. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. Plus, Aston Villa v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United, Chelsea v Leeds United, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Tottenham Hotspur and Southampton v Leicester City

programme.title: Going in Style (2017)
programme.desc: Joe Harding, Willie Davis and Albert Garner are lifelong friends who have been swindled out of their pension money by a Brooklyn bank. So the seasoned pals decide to steal their cash back in a daring robbery. Director Zach Braff's remake of George Burns's 1979 heist caper, starring Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine and Alan Arkin

programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bournemouth at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens and Newcastle shared the spoils in a thrilling 3-3 draw at St James' Park in August, but the champions will have hoped to make home advantage count this time around. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. Plus, Aston Villa v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United, Chelsea v Leeds United, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Tottenham Hotspur and Southampton v Leicester City

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Women of Faith: To mark International Women's Day, Claire McCollum visits Glasgow to uncover stories of women of faith throughout the ages, including the city's very own St Enochh, a Scottish princess in the 6th century who survived attempted murder and rape before giving birth to Glasgow's founder, Saint Mungo. Laura Wright meets Glaswegian women who are putting their faith into action

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph is in Surrey, rummaging through the rubbish at the Earlswood Recycling Centre. She enlists the help of Duncan McKean to transform an antique floor lamp and a trolley

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

Tom Heap is in East Anglia, investigating the threat to Britain's breadbasket, while Adam Henson looks into the impact of new farm payments. In the first of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles is in North Wales, finding out just what it takes to be a hill farmer

Silver specialist Duncan Campbell takes a look at a rare snuffbox from the Royal Collection that was made from Cornish silver, while books expert Justin Croft admires a copy of Gray's Elegy in a Country Churchyard

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc:
Vengeance Is Easy, Justice Is Hard: Palmer, who went to Tenerife on holiday with his family just before his attempted arrest, learns the police want to speak to him and publicly states his innocence in a television interview. Cooper and Parry successfully move the remaining criminal proceeds from Switzerland to Liechtenstein, but their courier gets caught at the border with the cash. Noye's murder trial comes to a dramatic conclusion

programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

He never spoke of his experiences during the First World War, so she tries to find out how he won his gallantry medals. Judi's investigations then take a truly epic turn, leading her to 16th-century Denmark and nobility. The actress also discovers, to her delight, some remarkable Shakespearean links

programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc:

In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

Laura Wright meets Glaswegian women who are putting their faith into action

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bournemouth at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens and Newcastle shared the spoils in a thrilling 3-3 draw at St James' Park in August, but the champions will have hoped to make home advantage count this time around. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. Plus, Aston Villa v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United, Chelsea v Leeds United, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Tottenham Hotspur and Southampton v Leicester City

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Women of Faith: To mark International Women's Day, Claire McCollum visits Glasgow to uncover stories of women of faith throughout the ages, including the city's very own St Enochh, a Scottish princess in the 6th century who survived attempted murder and rape before giving birth to Glasgow's founder, Saint Mungo. Laura Wright meets Glaswegian women who are putting their faith into action

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph is in Surrey, rummaging through the rubbish at the Earlswood Recycling Centre. She enlists the help of Duncan McKean to transform an antique floor lamp and a trolley

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Vanishing Villages: John Craven and Matt Baker are on the east coast of England to find out how storms are devouring the coastline, putting homes and livelihoods at threat. Tom Heap is in East Anglia, investigating the threat to Britain's breadbasket, while Adam Henson looks into the impact of new farm payments. In the first of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles is in North Wales, finding out just what it takes to be a hill farmer
S2023E11

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
The Eden Project, Cornwall 1: Fiona Bruce presents an episode filmed before the Accession, featuring the Queen Consort's visit to the Eden Project to discuss charity project The Big Lunch. Silver specialist Duncan Campbell takes a look at a rare snuffbox from the Royal Collection that was made from Cornish silver, while books expert Justin Croft admires a copy of Gray's Elegy in a Country Churchyard
S45E07

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc:
Vengeance Is Easy, Justice Is Hard: Palmer, who went to Tenerife on holiday with his family just before his attempted arrest, learns the police want to speak to him and publicly states his innocence in a television interview. Cooper and Parry successfully move the remaining criminal proceeds from Switzerland to Liechtenstein, but their courier gets caught at the border with the cash. Noye's murder trial comes to a dramatic conclusion
S01E04

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

He never spoke of his experiences during the First World War, so she tries to find out how he won his gallantry medals. Judi's investigations then take a truly epic turn, leading her to 16th-century Denmark and nobility. The actress also discovers, to her delight, some remarkable Shakespearean links

programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

They spend a magical night together and all seems perfect, but her dreams of him becoming her husband suffer a setback when she discovers she has already been hired to organise his marriage to another woman. Will true love find a way? Director Adam Shankman's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Matthew McConaughey, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Justin Chambers and Joanna Gleason

programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team bring more treasured family heirlooms, and the memories they hold, back to life. Ceramic conservator Kirsten Ramsay carefully restores a cherished but chipped piece of 1960s pottery, but with pieces missing and a highly polished finish to mimic she has her work cut out. A military campaign chest that's been through the wars and two much-loved Dutch chairs in need of caning are also restored
S02E13

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Shropshire: Nicki Chapman embarks on a house-hunting mission in the Shropshire countryside, balancing the dreams of a father who has a 475,000 budget and wants to head for the hills, while his daughter wants him to live closer to a community. Nicki also heads to Wenlock and tries her inexperienced hand at pot-throwing and the Japanese art of raku, a pot-firing technique that produces some dramatic results

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc:
The peaceful community of Shipton Abbott is rocked when beloved painting the Solo Mare disappears in a seemingly impossible heist while plans are in motion for its appearance at an exhibition. The theft is even more perplexing given the artwork was under the guard of PC Kelby Hartford at the time. Kelby feels responsible and Humphrey pulls out all the stops to recover the priceless piece. Drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc:
The Healer: DI Mooney and the team become embroiled in the mysterious world of faith healing when a blind woman dies while being treated by renowned healer Steadman King. When it turns out the victim was poisoned, all eyes turn to Steadman and his cup of holy water. But how could the prime suspect have carried out the deed in front of an audience without anyone noticing? Meanwhile, JP is put through his paces when Pico the police dog joins the team on a week-long trial, and Florence tries to recreate some of Jack's home comforts

programme.desc: San Francisco wedding planner Mary Fiore organises other people's nuptials but has never had much luck in love. One day she is swept off her feet by handsome doctor Steve Edison. They spend a magical night together and all seems perfect, but her dreams of him becoming her husband suffer a setback when she discovers she has already been hired to organise his marriage to another woman. Will true love find a way? Director Adam Shankman's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Matthew McConaughey, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Justin Chambers and Joanna Gleason

The 62-mile long pilgrims' route - named after the seventh-century hermit, healer and bishop St Cuthbert - links Melrose Abbey in the Scottish Borders where Cuthbert began his religious life, with his original burial place on the Holy Island of Lindisfarne off the Northumbrian coast
