programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/04/1994: Meat Loaf presents and performs on the chart show from April 14, 1994, also featuring Terrorvision, Reel 2 Real with the Mad Stuntman, Pet Shop Boys, Frances Ruffelle, Loveland vs Darlene Lewis, Garth Brooks, Toni Braxton and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/04/1994: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from April 21, 1994, featuring Crash Test Dummies, Bitty McLean, CJ Lewis, the Pretenders, Erasure, Crystal Waters, Deacon Blue, Toni Di Bart and Prince

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 02/03/1978: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from March 2, 1978, featuring performances by Darts, Kate Bush, Nick Lowe, Andy Williams, Samantha Sang, Rita Coolidge, the Tom Robinson Band and Abba

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 03/03/1983: John Peel and David Jensen present an edition from March 3, featuring OMD, Bananarama, Michael Jackson, and Patti Austin and James Ingram

programme.title: St David's Day at the BBC
programme.desc: A rummage through the BBC's music archives, featuring a selection of tracks from some of the most important and innovative Welsh artists of the past few decades. The programme includes performances by Manic Street Preachers, Catatonia, Super Furry Animals, Marina and the Diamonds, Stereophonics, Feeder, Shakin' Stevens, Bonnie Tyler, Shirley Bassey and Tom Jones

programme.title: Manics Back to Blackwood
programme.desc: Manic Street Preachers return to perform in their home town of Blackwood for the first time in more than 25 years. The intimate gig at the Miners' Institute features versions of hits spanning three decades, behind-the-scenes footage and an interview with the band

programme.title: Wales: Music Nation with Huw Stephens
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which Huw delves deep into the surprising and varied story of music in Wales by putting together a unique Welsh mixtape. Jumping from choirs to pop groups, Tom Jones to the triple harp, haunting medieval music to urban rap, Huw explores what makes Welsh music unique, and the qualities it shares right across the centuries. Contributors include Tom Jones, Manic Street Preachers and Dafydd Iwan

programme.title: Wales: Music Nation with Huw Stephens
programme.desc: In the second of two programmes, Huw takes a trip to the south Wales valleys to meet the world-famous Treorchy male voice choir, and to dig into the story of how another choir helped Wales become known as the Land of Song. At the other end of the country, Huw meets singer-songwriter Dafydd Iwan, whose song Yma o Hyd has recently become a football anthem

programme.title: St David's Day at the BBC
programme.desc: A rummage through the BBC's music archives, featuring a selection of tracks from some of the most important and innovative Welsh artists of the past few decades. The programme includes performances by Manic Street Preachers, Catatonia, Super Furry Animals, Marina and the Diamonds, Stereophonics, Feeder, Shakin' Stevens, Bonnie Tyler, Shirley Bassey and Tom Jones

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/04/1994: Meat Loaf presents and performs on the chart show from April 14, 1994, also featuring Terrorvision, Reel 2 Real with the Mad Stuntman, Pet Shop Boys, Frances Ruffelle, Loveland vs Darlene Lewis, Garth Brooks, Toni Braxton and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/04/1994: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from April 21, 1994, featuring Crash Test Dummies, Bitty McLean, CJ Lewis, the Pretenders, Erasure, Crystal Waters, Deacon Blue, Toni Di Bart and Prince

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 02/03/1978: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from March 2, 1978, featuring performances by Darts, Kate Bush, Nick Lowe, Andy Williams, Samantha Sang, Rita Coolidge, the Tom Robinson Band and Abba

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Out of Africa: The seasoned traveller explores the South American country, beginning in the north-east - where Europeans first landed and grew rich on the profits from sugar and tobacco plantations run with slave labour. In Sao Luis, Michael finds out about a ceremony based on a 200-year-old tale before heading to the coastal lagoons of the Lencois Maranhenses National Park. Journeying inland, he gets a glimpse of the fast-disappearing world of old-style cowboys known as vaqueiros, has his fortune read by a Candomble priest and learns to drum with the Olodum cultural collective
S01E01

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Into Amazonia: The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower
S01E02

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc:
The Paris vice squad begins to clean prostitutes off the city's streets, only to discover a man's body in the public park. Inspector Antoine Jouin heads up the investigation. In French
S01E01

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc:
Lepine asks Jouin to remain discreet in his report of a death to avoid a scandal. Marguerite Steinheil prepares for the opening of a new collection of her husband's work, to which she has invited Lepine. In French
S01E02

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc:
An angry audience member claims ownership of the episode's sketches. A teenage poet helps a headmaster to express himself and a drug dealer applies for a bank loan
S01E04

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc:
A lawyer cross-examines a witness, an actor reminisces about the people he's worked with over the years, and a couple at a christening can't decide what to name their child. Irreverent comedy with Stephen Fry and Hugh Laurie
S01E05

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Copper Kettle: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years. However, certain treasured memories remain. Originally shown in 1992
S01E03

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Out of Africa: The seasoned traveller explores the South American country, beginning in the north-east - where Europeans first landed and grew rich on the profits from sugar and tobacco plantations run with slave labour. In Sao Luis, Michael finds out about a ceremony based on a 200-year-old tale before heading to the coastal lagoons of the Lencois Maranhenses National Park. Journeying inland, he gets a glimpse of the fast-disappearing world of old-style cowboys known as vaqueiros, has his fortune read by a Candomble priest and learns to drum with the Olodum cultural collective
S01E01

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Into Amazonia: The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower
S01E02

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc:
Huw Stephens reveals how, as the 20th century dawned, artists found radical new ways to depict Wales, pushing themselves to extremes and redefining what art could be. His venture takes him to the National Museum Wales in Cardiff, Bardsey Island off the Llyn Peninsula, Colwyn Bay and Swansea
S01E03

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc:
Terry Wogan introduces another edition of the inter-regional dance contest from 1977, which sees Midlands and West compete against Home Counties North at the Locarno Ballroom, Bradford. Barri Haynes provides the commentary
S1977E02

programme.title: Revisor by Crystal Pite and Jonathon Young
programme.desc: A performance of the critically acclaimed dance-theatre production, created by award-winning choreographer Crystal Pite and playwright Jonathon Young, recorded at Sadler's Wells in March. Revisor is based on the well-known play The Government Inspector by Nikolai Gogol, and Young and Pite revised the archetypal comic plot to serve as the basis for a production that blends contemporary theatre and dance

programme.title: Listening Through the Lens: The Christopher Nupen Films
programme.desc: Documentary about the director who championed classical music on TV, seizing upon his unique access to a generation of musicians. Narrated by Stephen Fry

programme.title: We Want the Light: Jews and German Music
programme.desc: Documentary examining the complex relationship between Jews and German music, from Mendelssohn to Wagner, and the role of music in the German concentration camps

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Rio
programme.desc: Clive visits the Brazilian city of Rio de Janeiro, where the poor live by their wits in the favelas while the wealthy make contact with their less fortunate neighbours only when a servant is paid or a millionaire is mugged

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc:
Decadence and Degeneration: Actor Paul McGann explores the 1890s, a decade when science, entertainment, art and morality collided. He discovers how the works of HG Wells, Aubrey Beardsley and Oscar Wilde were shaped by fears of moral, social and racial degeneration, and explains how Wilde sought to subvert traditional Victorian values
S01E02

programme.title: Patagonia with Huw Edwards
programme.desc: The newsreader follows in the footsteps of settlers who travelled from Wales to Patagonia 150 years ago with the intention of creating a colony where their language and culture would endure. On arrival in South America, Huw meets descendants of the original immigrants and examines how much of their spirit lives on in the present

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
Bridging the Gap: How the Severn Bridge Was Built: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as 'the most perfect suspension bridge in the world', and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident
S16E01

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Newcastle to Co Durham: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. The first leg of his journey ends Spennymoor, Co Durham, where he meets the son of a miner who became one of the most famous 20th-century artists of the region
S11E01

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc:
Thorpeness - Suffolk: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Thorpeness in Suffolk, the first purpose-built seaside village in the UK. The ingenuity of amenities such as the hand-dug lake, country club and inland housing were the unique vision of Glencairn Stuart Ogilvie. Hamish Ogilvie helps Ben to understand his great-grandfather's vision, stemming from theatrical inspiration
S02E03

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc:
In the Beginning: Richard Miles charts the history of archaeological breakthroughs in a mission to understand the ancient past. In the first programme, he explores how the profession began by trying to prove a biblical truth
S01E01

programme.title: Art of France
programme.desc:
There Will Be Blood: Andrew Graham-Dixon explores how art in France took a dramatic turn after the Revolution ushered in a bold new world of artists including Jacques-Louis David and Theodore Gericault
S01E02

programme.title: Bent Coppers: Crossing the Line of Duty
programme.desc:
Exploring the sleazy underbelly of London's Soho in the early 1970s, where an explosion of dirty pornographic bookshops provides an open invitation for corrupt police to be greedy. With insider interviewers and archive footage, this episode continues to unearth the lawless underworld of 1970s London, audacious levels of police corruption and the birth of the internal force tasked with combating it
S01E02

programme.title: Big Sky, Big Dreams, Big Art: Made in the USA
programme.desc:
Waldemar Januszczak focuses on the America of small towns and trailer parks, discovering how these much-maligned territories had an immensely beneficial impact on American art. From the small-town brilliance of Grant Wood, to the small-town alienation of Edward Hopper, to the spooky Dust Bowl symbolism of Alexandre Hogue, interstitial America inspired much that was great. The film culminates in the assemblages of David Smith, the leading sculptor of Abstract Expressionism
S01E03

programme.title: Romancing the Stone: The Golden Ages of British Sculpture
programme.desc:
Children of the Revolution: Alastair Sooke examines sculpture in the 20th century, an era of innovation, scandal and creativity. He examines the artistic revolution spearheaded by Eric Gill and Jacob Epstein, which paved the way for the work of Gilbert & George and Damien Hirst. He also explores the art form's rise in popularity, from First World War memorials to the landmark work of Antony Gormley and Rachel Whiteread
S01E03

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Newcastle to Co Durham: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. The first leg of his journey ends Spennymoor, Co Durham, where he meets the son of a miner who became one of the most famous 20th-century artists of the region
S11E01

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc:
Thorpeness - Suffolk: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Thorpeness in Suffolk, the first purpose-built seaside village in the UK. The ingenuity of amenities such as the hand-dug lake, country club and inland housing were the unique vision of Glencairn Stuart Ogilvie. Hamish Ogilvie helps Ben to understand his great-grandfather's vision, stemming from theatrical inspiration
S02E03

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc:
In the Beginning: Richard Miles charts the history of archaeological breakthroughs in a mission to understand the ancient past. In the first programme, he explores how the profession began by trying to prove a biblical truth
S01E01

programme.title: Art of France
programme.desc:
There Will Be Blood: Andrew Graham-Dixon explores how art in France took a dramatic turn after the Revolution ushered in a bold new world of artists including Jacques-Louis David and Theodore Gericault
S01E02

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kielder Forest to Edinburgh: Michael Portillo is in Northumbria en route to the Highlands, heading to Kielder Forest to discover what lay behind a national initiative to plant one of the largest manmade woodlands in Europe. Crossing the border to Scotland, Michael arrives in the weaving town of Hawick to visit Lovat Mill, where, in the 1930s, tweed was big business, and also goes to the movies, sitting in the front stalls at the Dominion cinema in Morningside
S11E02

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc:
Alnmouth - Northumberland: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits Alnmouth, Northumberland, which was founded in the mid-12th century after the barons of nearby Alnwick obtained a charter from King John to build a new village. It had a market and a small port and the village flourished - so much so that by the mid-1700s, Alnmouth's grain export started to play an integral role in feeding the growing English population
S02E06

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Surprise, Surprise: Jean pays an unexpected visit during Lionel's lecture tour - only to be surprised herself. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S01E04

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc:
The second series of Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987
S02E03

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
Revolutions (1649-1689): Simon Schama charts the dramatic story of the political and religious upheavals in Britain following the death of Charles I. Republican leader Oliver Cromwell envisaged a godly kingdom, while Charles II restored the lustre of the monarchy. Subsequent anti-Catholicism during the brief reign of James II led to a pivotal uprising which would transform the country for ever
S01E09

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews
programme.desc:
Louis Theroux Interviews - Dame Judi Dench: Louis meets the Oscar-winning actress at her home in Surrey for a candid and lively conversation about her long career, her passion for theatre, her life away from acting and her relationship with her husband, the late Michael Williams. Louis also accompanies Judi to the Gielgud Theatre in London's West End, where they discuss the difficulties of the lockdown and how it inadvertently led to her surprise popularity on TikTok
S01E02

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary examining how the National Enquirer became the most infamous tabloid in America by churning out obscene stories that blur the lines between truth and fiction

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc:
Ade explores Tanzania, Ethiopia, and Somalia, visiting a game reserve where efforts are being made to halt the decline of elephant numbers. He tours Addis Ababa with former Olympic champion Haile Gebrselassie to discover why Ethiopia's economy has gone from strength to strength in recent years, and discovers the impact of war on Somalia, meeting a former NHS doctor who has returned to the country to help rebuild
S01E03

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kielder Forest to Edinburgh: Michael Portillo is in Northumbria en route to the Highlands, heading to Kielder Forest to discover what lay behind a national initiative to plant one of the largest manmade woodlands in Europe. Crossing the border to Scotland, Michael arrives in the weaving town of Hawick to visit Lovat Mill, where, in the 1930s, tweed was big business, and also goes to the movies, sitting in the front stalls at the Dominion cinema in Morningside
S11E02

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc:
Alnmouth - Northumberland: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits Alnmouth, Northumberland, which was founded in the mid-12th century after the barons of nearby Alnwick obtained a charter from King John to build a new village. It had a market and a small port and the village flourished - so much so that by the mid-1700s, Alnmouth's grain export started to play an integral role in feeding the growing English population
S02E06

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
Revolutions (1649-1689): Simon Schama charts the dramatic story of the political and religious upheavals in Britain following the death of Charles I. Republican leader Oliver Cromwell envisaged a godly kingdom, while Charles II restored the lustre of the monarchy. Subsequent anti-Catholicism during the brief reign of James II led to a pivotal uprising which would transform the country for ever
S01E09

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Falkirk to Dundee: Following the route of the old Caledonian Railway Company, Michael Portillo discovers the 'Riviera of the Highlands'. With a daily direct train service to Kings Cross, Gleneagles remains a top destination and is also headquarters for the British School of Falconry. Berry Town, aka Blairgowrie, is Michael's next stop. At the home of the Scottish raspberry industry, which once sent fruit to London daily on board a raspberry special service from Cooper Angus station, Michael learns how to pick this most delicate of berries. The last stop on this leg is the city of Dundee, where he visits publisher DC Thomson
S11E03

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc:
Staithes - North Yorkshire: In the early 19th century Staithes was as one of the largest east coast fishing ports, and even now the harbour building renovations reveal the seaside village's impressive financial boom. Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the harsh North Yorkshire coastline that surrounds Staithes, as he finds out how the village was built to be a safe haven. It was also a settlement rich in the natural resource of shale. Contributors include local author Peter Appleton and fellow archaeologist Caroline Barrie Smith
S02E02

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc:
Masterminds: The presenter introduces the unique talents of the world's most intelligent animals, investigating how nature's masterminds measure up against human brain power. Looking at a variety of animals, such as ravens, crows, bees and starlings, Chris explores how different animals can use tools, solve complex puzzles, recognise themselves in mirrors and even reason like humans
S01E01

programme.title: Six Wives with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc:
Documentary charting key moments in the lives of Henry VIII's wives, combining dramatised scenes with the presenter's own contemporary historical comment. In this episode, Lucy follows Catherine of Aragon through her emotional and physical struggles to give Henry the heir he so desperately needs to continue his dynasty. When Catherine finally gives birth to a baby girl, Henry's eye wanders to the ladies at court - first Mary Boleyn, and then to her sister, Anne
S01E01

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc:
Catherine of Aragon: Classic drama focusing on the Tudor monarch's relationships with each of his wives. Catherine is widowed at only 16, and after the death of the miserly Henry VII, she marries the young handsome Henry VIII. Could any two people be so much in love? Starring Roger Michell and Annette Crosbie. From 1970
S01E01

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc:
Anne Boleyn: Classic drama focusing on the Tudor monarch and his wives. Catherine is dead and Anne Boleyn is now queen, but two years on her promise to give Henry a son remains unfulfilled - and the outcome will lead more than one person to the scaffold. Starring Roger Michell and Dorothy Tutin. From 1970
S01E02

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Falkirk to Dundee: Following the route of the old Caledonian Railway Company, Michael Portillo discovers the 'Riviera of the Highlands'. With a daily direct train service to Kings Cross, Gleneagles remains a top destination and is also headquarters for the British School of Falconry. Berry Town, aka Blairgowrie, is Michael's next stop. The last stop on this leg is the city of Dundee, where he visits publisher DC Thomson
S11E03

It was also a settlement rich in the natural resource of shale. Contributors include local author Peter Appleton and fellow archaeologist Caroline Barrie Smith
S02E02

programme.title: Six Wives with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc:
Documentary charting key moments in the lives of Henry VIII's wives, combining dramatised scenes with the presenter's own contemporary historical comment. In this episode, Lucy follows Catherine of Aragon through her emotional and physical struggles to give Henry the heir he so desperately needs to continue his dynasty. When Catherine finally gives birth to a baby girl, Henry's eye wanders to the ladies at court - first Mary Boleyn, and then to her sister, Anne

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews
programme.desc:
Louis Theroux Interviews - Dame Judi Dench: Louis meets the Oscar-winning actress at her home in Surrey for a candid and lively conversation about her long career, her passion for theatre, her life away from acting and her relationship with her husband, the late Michael Williams. Louis also accompanies Judi to the Gielgud Theatre in London's West End, where they discuss the difficulties of the lockdown and how it inadvertently led to her surprise popularity on TikTok
S01E02

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Dundee to Aberdeen: Michael Portillo continues his railway journey from Newcastle to Loch Ness, steered by his 1930s Bradshaw's Guide. Stopping at Dundee, Michael heads for Glamis Castle, where Lady Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon, the Queen Mother, grew up. Michael hears about her happy childhood and how she later found sanctuary there, when King Edward VIII abdicated and she and Prince Albert unexpectedly became king and queen of the United Kingdom
S11E04

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc:
Arnside - Cumbria: Archaeologist Ben Robinson pays a visit to the beautifully preserved village of Arnside, sitting just outside the Lake District on the banks of the River Kent. Once serving the port of Milnthorpe, the village expanded with the arrival of ship carpenter John Crossfield, leading to its expansion in the early 1800s as part of the boat-building industry. Ben talks to Victorian industry expert Dr Stephen Caunce and meets a descendant of the Crossfields family, talking about the village's tourist success and architectural history
S02E05

programme.title: The Blob: A Genius without a Brain
programme.desc: Documentary about leading scientists' investigations into the properties of a one-billion-year-old, single-cell organism that could challenge the concept of intelligent life

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures Shorts
programme.desc: Around the World in 80 Treasures: Dan Cruickshank's journey takes him through Japan, where he marvels at the craftsmanship of a samurai sword

programme.title: The Eagle Has Landed (1976)
programme.desc: A Nazi secret agent plans to kidnap Winston Churchill while the prime minister spends a weekend in the Norfolk countryside, and plants covert operatives in the area ready for his arrival. Second World War adventure, adapted from Jack Higgins' novel, starring Michael Caine, Donald Sutherland, Robert Duvall, Jenny Agutter, Donald Pleasence, Anthony Quayle and Jean Marsh

programme.title: Going in Style (2017)
programme.desc: Joe Harding, Willie Davis and Albert Garner are lifelong friends who have been swindled out of their pension money by a Brooklyn bank. So the seasoned pals decide to steal their cash back in a daring robbery. Director Zach Braff's remake of George Burns's 1979 heist caper, starring Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine and Alan Arkin

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc:
Michael Caine: Talking Pictures: The life of acting legend Michael Caine, star of movies such as The Ipcress File, The Italian Job, and The Dark Knight. Using rare TV interviews and classic archive clips, this programme tells the story of one of Britain's most successful actors. Narrated by Sylvia Syms
S01E33

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures
programme.desc:
Homeward Bound: Dan Cruickshank concludes his round-the-world trip with visits to some of Europe's greatest treasures, including the recently destroyed and rebuilt Mostar bridge, symbolically connecting the Christian and Muslim worlds, and the Parthenon in Athens. Italy figures heavily on his travels, as he explores Venice, Rome and Florence in search of marvels of the Roman Empire and the Renaissance - including the Pantheon and the chapel of the Medici princes
S01E10

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Dundee to Aberdeen: Michael Portillo continues his railway journey from Newcastle to Loch Ness, steered by his 1930s Bradshaw's Guide. Stopping at Dundee, Michael heads for Glamis Castle, where Lady Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon, the Queen Mother, grew up. Michael hears about her happy childhood and how she later found sanctuary there, when King Edward VIII abdicated and she and Prince Albert unexpectedly became king and queen of the United Kingdom
S11E04

programme.desc:
Arnside - Cumbria: Archaeologist Ben Robinson pays a visit to the beautifully preserved village of Arnside, sitting just outside the Lake District on the banks of the River Kent. Once serving the port of Milnthorpe, the village expanded with the arrival of ship carpenter John Crossfield, leading to its expansion in the early 1800s as part of the boat-building industry. Ben talks to Victorian industry expert Dr Stephen Caunce and meets a descendant of the Crossfields family, talking about the village's tourist success and architectural history
S02E05

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 28/04/1994: Nicky Campbell presents the chart show from April 28, 1994, featuring Ride, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Skin, Eternal, Club House, Level 42, Barbra Streisand, Michael Bolton and Prince

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 05/05/1994: Simon Mayo introduces Evan Dando, Killing Joke, the Cranberries, CJ Lewis, the Manchester United Football Squad, Judy Cheeks, Richard Marx, Stiltskin and Tony Di Bart from May 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 13/03/1980: Steve Wright presents an edition first broadcast March 13, 1980, with performances by the Dooleys, the Police, Detroit Spinners, Brothers Johnson, Secret Affair, Liquid Gold, the Vapors, Rainbow, Siouxsie & the Banshees, the Gibson Brothers, Peter Gabriel, Marti Webb, Genesis and Fern Kinney. Plus, dance sequences by Legs & Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 07/03/1985: John Peel and Janice Long present the March 7 1985 edition, featuring Shakin' Stevens, Madonna, Jermaine Jackson and Dead or Alive

programme.title: My Name Is Ottilie
programme.desc: Soul singer Dana Masters recounts the story of the 'Godmother of British blues' Ottilie Patterson from her beginning in Muddy Water's blues club in Chicago, her time as the acclaimed singer with the Chris Barber Band to her sudden disappearance from the music industry. Featuring Jools Holland, Jacqui Dankworth, Dick Taylor, Stu Morrison, Ronnie Greer and a never before heard interview with the Co Down-born singer herself

programme.title: Oscar Peterson: Words and Music
programme.desc: Archive programme in which the jazz pianist talks to guests including bandleader and composer Count Basie and guitarist Joe Pass

programme.title: In Concert: Oscar Peterson
programme.desc: Performance by the Oscar Peterson Trio at the Ronnie Scott's Club in 1974, featuring such songs as I Should Care, This Nearly Was Mine, Soulville Summer, On the Trail, Watch What Happens and A Time for Love. Part of Swing season

programme.title: Jazz Piano Gold
programme.desc: Archive footage of performances from 1964 to 2009 by artists including Count Basie, Thelonious Monk, Oscar Peterson, Abdullah Ibrahim, Stan Tracey, Jacques Loussier, Duke Ellington, Return to Forever and Herbie Hancock. Clips are taken from shows such as Jazz 625 and Later with Jools Holland

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 28/04/1994: Nicky Campbell presents the chart show from April 28, 1994, featuring Ride, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Skin, Eternal, Club House, Level 42, Barbra Streisand, Michael Bolton and Prince

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
What Happens in Helmand: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Toy Soldier: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller
S01E02

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Truffle Hog: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn
S01E03

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lichfield (1/5): Business consultant James Herbert hosts the first dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, and has high hopes that his guests - football coach Tim Travers, sales assistant JP Goodyear-Martinez, businesswoman Amanda Smith and retired mental-health nurse Ronnie Imlah - will enjoy his complex Italian menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lichfield (2/5): Retired mental-health nurse Ronnie Imlah hosts the second dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, hoping her menu inspired by dishes she has eaten at friends' events will win her the 1,000. A revelation by the host leaves her companions in shock, and two guests fail to see eye-to-eye on plastic surgery

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lichfield (3/5): JP Goodyear-Martinez hosts the third dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, where he treats his guests to a mix of Jamaican food, tight Lycra outfits and a drag queen. However, James Herbert's rendition of Queen's Bohemian Rhapsody does not go down too well with fellow diner Ronnie

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lichfield (4/5): Football coach Tim Travers hosts the fourth dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, and is determined to prove his culinary skills, despite never having cooked before. He tackles an American-themed menu with the help of his mother, but discovers the hardest task is keeping the peace at the table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lichfield (5/5): Recruitment consultant Amanda Smith hosts the final dinner party in Lichfield, and hopes to impress with a well-executed, sophisticated menu. However the night is not to everyone else's liking and an accident at the table leaves her guests in hysterics, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Lucca, Tuscany: Lee and Lynn Fox from South Yorkshire have been regular visitors to the Tuscan city of Lucca since Lee's job as a mechanical engineer first took him there over 10 years ago. Lynn's hairdressing business and Lee's job keep the couple very busy, so making the most of their quality time together is key. Laura Hamilton makes it her mission to show them a variety of properties as close to the city centre as possible, on a budget of 170,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Orihuela Costa, Spain: Leah Charles-King is in Spain's Orihuela Costa to help Donna and Graeme find their perfect holiday home. They're after a light and airy two or three-bedroom apartment. Leah seeks out five impressive properties for the couple's budget of 75,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc:
A trip back to see how couple Kimmie and Matt are getting on building a gte in France. As they near completion, freak weather threatens to wash away all their plans. Plus, a visit to Spain to see if a new route can keep hiking and cycling tour operators Heather and Wayne on the road to success
S05E09

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 1/5: DJ Kevin hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in and around Swansea, hoping to win his guests over with an evening inspired by his favourite holiday destination of Benidorm

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 2/5: This week's competition is in and around Swansea, where second host, caf bar owner Tino, is hoping to wow her guests with an African banquet inspired by her homeland of Zimbabwe

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 3/5: For the third visit of the week in Swansea, beautician Natalie hopes to impress her guests with a George Michael-themed evening

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 4/5: Bodybuilder Rob hopes his Thai-themed menu will impress the guests in Swansea, but his starter lacks a vital component and his main is incredibly similar to the previous course

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 5/5: In Swansea, GP and keen tennis player Janine hopes to serve up an ace with a tennis-themed evening. The night kicks off with everyone dressed up for Centre Court - and bodybuilder Rob turning up in a mini skirt. Benidorm-loving DJ Kev is overcome with emotion as he tells the gang that this is the best week of his life, while cafe bar owner Tino decides to pick fault with Janine's dishes instead

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Algarve: Steph and Ian are looking for their dream holiday home on Portugal's Algarve for an ideal budget of 280,000. With retirement fast approaching, the couple would love to find an apartment with a pool that's also in easy reach of the stunning sandy beaches of Albufeira, so that they can enjoy lots of time in the sunshine with their four grandchildren. Property expert Ben Hillman lines up five options for the pair to consider

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc:
The air ambulance teams battle to save cyclist Graham's partially amputated leg, while Rose is freed from a rolled car in Buckinghamshire. Gary suffers a rare and extremely serious complete knee dislocation playing football, but strong pain relief results in some unexpected hilarity

To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the show, George tracks down a former contributor from the first-ever series, to find out how Amazing Spaces has changed his - and George's - life. While in Israel, George drives into the desert to track down a small but breathtaking natural build and, after finding a name for his caravan and moving it 250 miles from its build site in Bedford to its final home in the Lakes, George's own 10th anniversary build is finally finished, and he can reveal his unique Arts and Crafts caravan

Chihuahuas Bear and Dave try to convince seven-year-old husky-fan Ollie that two little dogs are better than one

programme.title: Military Wives (2019)
programme.desc: With their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the centre of a media sensation and global movement. As unexpected bonds of friendship flourish, music and laughter transform their lives, helping them to overcome their fears for their loved ones in combat. programme.desc:

programme.desc:

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Costa del Sol: Laura Hamilton helps a Cardiff couple with two teenage children to find a holiday home around Mijas on Spain's Costa del Sol, on a budget of 200,000

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Kirstie and Phil look back on some of their most interesting renovations and house-hunts, starting with Sophie and Paul in Aylesbury, who were divided over their three-bed house which Paul bought himself. After meeting Sophie and having two children together, Paul decided he wanted to move into a bigger and better family home while Sophie wanted to stay in the area with her family nearby. Amy and Louis in Cowbridge, Wales were in turmoil over their period home which Louis had inherited from his late grandmother. The house held many memories for Louis but with his recent diagnosis and the upkeep required, Amy doubted it could be a long-term home for them

programme.desc:

Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:

An 84-year-old man collapses at home following a bout of dizziness, and his children reflect on the challenges of watching his health decline in recent years
S24E06

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc:
Alice Levine continues to explore the sex lives of others, discovering out-of-the-ordinary love stories from across the world. In this first episode, she dives into new, advanced technologies that could be what sex and relationships will look like in the future, meeting a couple in Berlin who opened the world's first cyber-brothel, populated by talking sex dolls. She heads to Las Vegas to witness the next generation of sex-robots and also meets a couple whose relationship exists in a virtual 'furry' universe, but who are about to risk it all, taking their love affair offline and moving across the world to be together IRL (In Real Life)
S02E01

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc:
Using ground-breaking technology, individuals considering cosmetic surgery get to see themselves like they have never seen before through full-size avatars of their naked bodies. In the opening episode, Vogue Williams meets chiselled carpenter Steven, who wants a porn star-sized penis, and single mum Steph, who is desperate for smaller boobs. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them?
S01E01

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc:
Guy investigates the future of energy production, travelling to Orkney to look at how the Scottish islands are at the forefront of hydrogen research. He also joins the workforce at Europe's biggest building site and the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station, finding out why reactors are so expensive and take 10 years to build, and works inside Britain's most toxic site - handling nuclear waste inside the Sellafield facility
S01E03

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall
programme.desc: In the fold of the foothills of Exmoor, Devon farmers Rob and Sarah Taylor prepare their native ponies for the show season, but first they need to round them up from off the moor. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool: In Liverpool, property developer Christine plans to wow her guests with a Spanish holiday-themed dinner party. However, the mood is rather more feisty than fiesta as on-going tensions finally come to a head and it's not long before the honesty - and the sparks - begin to fly

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Granada: Tina Watkins has long struggled to get on the housing ladder in the UK. Now, she has decided to make the most of the incredibly good value property in Spain's Granada province and buy her first-ever home. With her best friend Jamie along to help, Jasmine Harman shows Tina just how far her 19,000 budget will stretch

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Rick and Inge cannot wait to fulfill their dream of buying a holiday home in Tala in western Cyprus, near the beautiful beaches of Coral Bay. The cat-crazy couple ask Jean Johansson to help them find a detached villa for their budget of 260,000, with plenty of space for a feline family and a 'man cave' for Rick's DIY

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc:
Catching up with a father and daughter horse riding duo in Italy, who need to think on their feet if they are to survive another hot Italian summer. Marc and Natalia's paddleboarding business in Spain branches out into new territory, and on the Costa Blanca, Dan, Rik and Rex have their dreams of owning a gin distillery dashed
S05E11

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Winchester 1/5: Ptol Slattery hosts the first dinner party in Winchester, Hampshire, but his menu of seared scallops, lamb steak with baby new potatoes followed by chocolate mousse leaves his guests - waitress Patrician Pearson, DJ Francis Leigh, care-home worker Georgia Groves and estate agent William Tilsley - underwhelmed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Winchester 2/5: DJ Francis Leigh hosts the next dinner party in Winchester, hoping to dazzle his guests with his sunburnt chicken curry, a Thai meal with a twist and a dessert simply called 'sticky.' The entertainment for the night proves to be weird and wonderful as he dons a tutu and fur coat to serve the main course

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Winchester 3/5: Waitress Patricia Pearson hosts the next party in Winchester, but the decision to write her menu in Spanish causes confusion for one guest who mistakes lamb for llama. The Peruvian-themed feast is followed by a rendition of the country's national anthem and a traditional dance involving a candle and a donkey's jaw

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Winchester 4/5: On the fourth night of the competition in Winchester, Georgia Groves plans a black-tie evening complete with a red carpet, posh frocks and a spray-tan booth. It appears to be going well until Patricia Pearson reveals what she thinks of Ptol Slattery and his wine antics

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Winchester 5/5: Estate agent William Tilsley throws one last dinner party as a week of competitions in Winchester, Hampshire, draws to a close. The host plans to offer his guests a vegetarian menu, with a blind food-tasting game providing the evening's entertainment. As the night draws to a close, one of the competitors rises above the rest to become the winner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Charente, France: Jasmine Harman heads to the Charente region of France to help a couple find a holiday home to enjoy with their children and grandchildren. For their budget of 250,000, Sarah and Greg would like a traditional French cottage or converted barn with four bedrooms in a rural location

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc:
The air ambulance teams are called out to help Dennis, who's suffering a heart attack. A spin on her bike has catastrophic consequences for Carolyn. Plus, there's a dramatic night-time car crash in Norfolk
S01E07

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
Woodgreen animal charity staff set about matching their homeless dogs with more prospective owners. Eighty-five-year-old Pim thinks Dexter the beagle is as stubborn as Elizabeth, his wife of 62 years. It's possible that shy Jack Russell Roxy could prove a better match. Chihuahuas Bear and Dave try to convince seven-year-old husky-fan Ollie that two little dogs are better than one
S03E03

programme.title: Jamie's 1 Wonders
programme.desc:
Jamie Oliver presents recipes that keep costs under control in the kitchen. In the first episode, he shares a roast chicken recipe that saves both time and money by filling chicken thighs with a super-simple stuffing to make the meat stretch further. Plus, a pancake batter-based dish with layers of spinach, ham and cheese and a pizza that doesn't even need you to turn on the oven
S01E01

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on Bad Sisters, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, The Kardashians, Super/Natural, Emma Willis: Delivering Babies, and A Trip to Infinity, as well as BBC News reports on the energy cap and a U-turn by Kwasi Kwarteng. First broadcast in October 2022
S20E05

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc:
Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz as Richard Ayoade and Sara Pascoe take on Jon Richardson and Chris McCausland. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate, aided by Morgana Robinson in Dictionary Corner
S23E04

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc:
Part two of two. How George Michael announced his sexuality to the world in 1998 and the events that led to it including losing his partner to an Aids-related illness, being arrested for committing a lewd act in a public toilet and threats from the News of the World to publish pictures of him cruising in a park. Will Young shares how the events gave hope to young gay men at the time
S01E02

programme.title: Bad Teacher (2011)
programme.desc: Cynical, hard-drinking teacher Elizabeth Halsey hates her job and the kids in her class, and hopes to escape her daily grind by landing a rich husband. A wealthy substitute seems like a suitable candidate, but she has a rival for his attention in a squeaky-clean colleague. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Jason Segel and Lucy Punch

programme.title: Katie Price's Mucky Mansion
programme.desc:
Katie creates her own makeup room and brings new life to the shabby stables. After spotting a paparazzi photographer, she takes a moment to reflect on how these moments impact her mental health
S02E03

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc:
Alice travels from London to Washington, DC meeting people who are entering relationships with multiple partners in a bid for more sex and a deeper connection, including a 20-person polycule - a group of open-minded lovers who have created an ever-evolving support system through their intertwined sex lives. Back in the British suburbs, she meet a young married couple whose dalliances with other couples has helped strengthen their relationship
S02E02

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc:
The architect explores an arts and crafts-inspired house in Surrey. Built in the 1920s, it has tall chimneys, leaded windows, gabled ends and a steeply pitched roof. Sadly, it has Artex everywhere and incorporates some dubious design alterations. He sets out to help its owners turn it back into an elegant home for themselves and their three children. George also tackles a suburban home that has so many layers of wallpaper that peeling them back is like going back through a time warp
S08E03

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merseyside 1/5: Oil and gas co-ordinator Danielle Greenwood is keen to impress as she hosts the first dinner party in the Merseyside area, as she welcomes divorcee Jade Chantelle Short, Michael Buble impersonator Jamie Somers, pastoral care manager Steven Booth, and nursery school teacher Anna Senior into her home. Danielle takes no risks with a down-to-earth menu, which she hopes will help bag her the 1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merseyside 2/5: Pastoral care manager Steven Booth hosts the second Merseyside dinner party, and names each course after a Tina Turner song, hoping to win the 1,000 prize. The food is well received, but tensions rise when one guest makes a tactless comment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merseyside 3/5: Glamorous PR representative Jade Chantelle hosts the third night in Merseyside, where she hopes a casino-themed evening with lashings of champagne and a high-class menu will help her to win the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merseyside 4/5: Primary school teacher Anna Senior hosts the fourth night in Merseyside with a fairy tale-themed evening. Her menu consists of a Mad Hatter's soup and sandwich, a special pork dish cooked three ways and baked cheesecake for dessert, but she must try to control the tension between Jamie and Jade to have a successful party

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merseyside 5/5: Michael Bubl impersonator Jamie Somers hosts the final Merseyside dinner party, but may have to put aside his differences with guest Jade if he is to be crowned the winner of the 1,000 cash prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Costa del Sol: Jon and Lynne Scopes from Stockport have thought about buying a property abroad for years and have viewed more than 40 apartments without success, but have at least decided their ideal area is Mijas on Spain's Costa del Sol. Jasmine Harman has the daunting task of finding them the perfect property for their 100,000 budget, but will anything meet their exacting standards?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Tenerife: Lou and Tony dream of buying their own Spanish holiday home to enjoy with all their family. They're looking for a house with great views and lots of outdoor space for Tony to exercise his green fingers on the Canary island of Tenerife. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties for their budget of 350,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc:
Ali tries to keep her Spanish dream alive with a new business plan and Christine and Pete are having second thoughts just a year after opening their restaurant. In France, gite owners Lee and Zandra have their sights set on expansion
S05E12

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Kent 1/5: Clairvoyant Yvette Tamara hosts the first dinner party in north Kent, and the night gets off to a spooky start when data analyst John Tower and working mother Yemi Christopher-Soares discover a ghost-busting machine. Meanwhile, jeweller Lisa Townend is so impressed with Yvette's abilities that she wants to return for a psychic reading

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Kent 2/5: Data analyst John Tower hosts the second dinner party in north Kent, and lets his passion for military re-enactment show when he barks orders at the table. However, not all the guests enjoy his fatty pork stew and psychedelic dessert, and two argue over dating etiquette

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Kent 3/5: Project manager Yemi Christopher-Soares hosts the third dinner party in north Kent, where she hopes the guests will enjoy her Nigerian-inspired menu and appreciate her love of all things spicy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Kent 4/5: Jono Simm hosts the penultimate dinner party in north Kent and is convinced his wholesome and hearty menu is the way to win. However, two of his guests are less than impressed by his cooking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Kent 5/5: Party-loving Lisa Townend hosts the final dinner party in north Kent, and hopes that a menu full of French fancies and innovative entertainment in the form of human roulette, will be enough to impress her guests and see her crowned winner of the 1,000 cash prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Lanzarote: Mother and daughter Michelle and Charlotte from Stevenage are looking for Michelle's dream holiday home on Lanzarote. As a family of four, they have been coming to the island for more than 10 years and feel particularly at home in the seaside town of Playa Blanca. Ben Hillman lines up five properties for their 110,000 budget

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc:
A tennis player is put into an induced coma after suffering a heart attack on the court, a fell runner is seriously injured by cows, and a man is crushed under a collapsed wall
S01E08

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2019: Skopelos: Celebrity photographer John wants to celebrate his 60th birthday by relocating to the idyllic Greek Island of Skopelos. Having fallen in love with its beautiful scenery and relaxing way of life, all he needs is to find his dream property - so friend Helen is coming along for support. Ben Hillman selects five options to put in the frame for his 120,000 budget, hoping at least one will be John's idea of perfection

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc:
It's the semi-final and the potters are making pieces for the bathroom before taking on the iconic Moorcroft tube lining in the surprise second challenge
S2023E09

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see
S21E02

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc:
Part one of two. How the singer's outing was a landmark moment in gay politics, with a potential career-ending scandal being averted by seizing control of the media narrative. The first episode looks back at the singer's early career, and unearths the reasons he felt compelled to remain in the closet in the first place. Featuring contributions from former manager Simon Napier-Bell and Rev Richard Coles, who recalls his own experiences of being a gay man and a pop star in the 1980s
S01E01

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc:
Part two of two. How George Michael announced his sexuality to the world in 1998 and the events that led to it including losing his partner to an Aids-related illness, being arrested for committing a lewd act in a public toilet and threats from the News of the World to publish pictures of him cruising in a park. Will Young shares how the events gave hope to young gay men at the time
S01E02

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc:
The final stop on the search for Britain's best amateur pianists is Birmingham New Street Station. Featuring a toe-tapping Jerry Lee Lewis hit and a unique Harry Styles cover. There is not a dry eye in the station when a Welsh retiree goes on a trip down memory lane. As per usual, the unsuspecting performers are being watched by Lang Lang and Mika who are looking for a pianist to play at the Royal Festival Hall
S01E04

programme.title: Kathy Burke: Growing Up
programme.desc:
Kathy Burke contemplates if she should fight or accept old age and asks if it's easier or harder to be young in today's world by speaking to some ordinary people with extraordinary lives. In the first of this two-part special, Kathy examines getting older and how she feels about what is to come in later life, she learns from 85 year-old model Bridget and a 70 year-old dominatrix that raging against the realities that come with old age might be the secret to aging disgracefully and with dignity. Featuring contributions from Bill Bailey and Jennifer Saunders
S01E01

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Vilamoura: Mike and Amanda Gadd and their two children have always holidayed on the Algarve, a place that holds a special place in their hearts. Mike often works away with his job as a salesman, so they've decided to buy a holiday home there to give them a place to spend quality time together. Ben Hillman shows them five properties around their favourite town of Vilamoura for their 127,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Albox: Kent couple Alison and Lee are making a permanent move to the stunning countryside of Albox in Almera. They need a garden that's secure enough for their four dogs to roam safely, and the property must be big enough to host their six grown-up children and three grandchildren. Ben Hillman lines up some impressive properties for their budget of 150,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc:
Former B&B owner Louisa has dreams of running a holiday rental business on the Costa del Sol. Richard and Eileen host an outdoor wedding in 40 degree heat in France and ice cream makers Chris and Ariane consider hanging up their aprons for good
S05E13

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 1/5: The competition visits the Nottingham and Derby area. American Hali kicks proceeding off with a travel-inspired menu, including Moroccan chicken cigars and an unusual dessert combination. With a very gregarious gathering of guests, the food plays second fiddle to a fun night of impressions, dance moves and kitchen chaos

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 2/5: The competition continues in the Nottingham and Derby area. Car salesman Alistair hopes to step the competition up a gear. However, after narrowly avoiding an argument last night with Lesley, the veteran of the group, he's treading on thin ice. And he's serving up a bizarre menu, including chilli soup - for dessert - and prunes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 3/5: In Nottingham, fun-loving funeral arranger Kim hosts an evening packed with games galore and a mixed bag menu. Fifty-seven-year-old Lesley is again the butt of car salesman Alistair's geriatric jibes and takes great delight in watching him put on the spot during a dance-off

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 4/5: Customer relations associate and part-time drag queen Adam plans a theatrical night of flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area. Can he get his guests begging for an encore, will Alastair and Lesley ever kiss and make up and what will Adam's guests think of his secret hobby as a ufologist?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 5/5: The final soiree in the Nottingham and Derby area sees 57-year-old Lesley counting on a night of glamour and glitz - plus some good home-cooked food - to secure the 1,000 prize. However, before any food is even dished up, the guests make a surprising discovery about the host

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Charente, France: Jasmine Harman heads to the Charente region of France to help a couple find a holiday home to enjoy with their children and grandchildren. For their budget of 250,000, Sarah and Greg would like a traditional French cottage or converted barn with four bedrooms in a rural location

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc:
Mountain-biker Ivan sustains a serious head injury in a fall in a remote part of a forest. In Teesside, four-year-old Abithan needs strong pain relief when he breaks his thigh bone. Plus, 84-year-old farmer Derek fractures a previous hip replacement when he falls off a ladder
S01E09

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc:
Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Bristol with Josh and Anna, who are buying their first home together, and Sue and Samira, who are moving from London to a city they barely know for a change of pace in their life. However, one couple have a budget that falls short of their requirements, while the other pair appear to lack confidence when it comes to making a decision
S37E02

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Kirstie and Phil look back on two very different downstairs dilemmas, with one family surrendering their space to pets and another struggling to entertain the community they serve. Newly-weds Matt and Lucia struggled to fit their family into their living space as most of it had been given to their rescued pets, while Baptist minister Chris and Caroline had a severe lack of space in an already-extended property as they regularly host upwards of 14 people in their four-bed home
S04E02

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Billingshurst, Sussex 2021: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With 190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life
S21E02

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A doctor shares his story of leaving his family and newborn child during lockdown to keep them safe. An 11-year-old hit by a car shows signs of possible internal bleeding, and a 60-year-old woman is injured after tripping over her cat. A footballer being treated for injuries to his achilles tendon describes how the sport has been an escape for him during his childhood in south London
S24E05

programme.title: Katie Price's Mucky Mansion
programme.desc:

programme.title: Kathy Burke: Growing Up
programme.desc:
The actress contemplates getting older and explores the lives and experiences of the old and the young, wondering whether people should fight or accept old age. In the second of two programmes, Kathy examines being young and looks back on her much-loved youth when she was carefree and confident. Contributors include her showbiz pals Jennifer Saunders, Bill Bailey, Charlotte Church and TikTok sensation Francis Bourgeois

Architect George Clarke follows people as they attempt to breathe new life into these properties. First up are Cornwall couple Richard and Sarah, who bought their former local high street bank for 50,000 and now face the challenge of converting the Victorian grade II-listed building into a unique family home

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Berkshire v French Alps: With their children flying the nest, Andy and Alida have decided now is the time to fulfil their dream of buying a chalet in the French Alps. They are downsizing their house in Wokingham, Surrey, and splitting the funds between the UK and France, so Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin have been sent on a joint mission. With a total of 650,000 to spend, and three shots each to find the perfect property - Laura in Berkshire and Jonnie in the ski-resort of Morzine - the pressure is really on for both of them to deliver

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc:
Car Crash Emergencies: Steph is trapped with multiple injuries after a bad smash near Alnwick in Northumberland. An accident with a bonfire leaves Paul with serious burns, while in Norfolk's Thetford Forest it's difficult for the medics to reach horse-rider Alice, who has badly broken her ankle
S01E10

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc:
The architect explores an arts and crafts-inspired house in Surrey. Built in the 1920s, it has tall chimneys, leaded windows, gabled ends and a steeply pitched roof. Sadly, it has Artex everywhere and incorporates some dubious design alterations. He sets out to help its owners turn it back into an elegant home for themselves and their three children. George also tackles a suburban home that has so many layers of wallpaper that peeling them back is like going back through a time warp
S08E03

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc:
Victorian Bank, Cornwall: Across Britain, more than 600,000 buildings lie unused and unloved, and nearly a third of them are commercial. Architect George Clarke follows people as they attempt to breathe new life into these properties. First up are Cornwall couple Richard and Sarah, who bought their former local high street bank for 50,000 and now face the challenge of converting the Victorian grade II-listed building into a unique family home
S01E01

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A doctor shares his story of leaving his family and newborn child during lockdown to keep them safe. An 11-year-old hit by a car shows signs of possible internal bleeding, and a 60-year-old woman is injured after tripping over her cat. A footballer being treated for injuries to his achilles tendon describes how the sport has been an escape for him during his childhood in south London
S24E05

programme.title: Kathy Burke: Growing Up
programme.desc:
Kathy Burke contemplates if she should fight or accept old age and asks if it's easier or harder to be young in today's world by speaking to some ordinary people with extraordinary lives. In the first of this two-part special, Kathy examines getting older and how she feels about what is to come in later life, she learns from 85 year-old model Bridget and a 70 year-old dominatrix that raging against the realities that come with old age might be the secret to aging disgracefully and with dignity. Featuring contributions from Bill Bailey and Jennifer Saunders
S01E01

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see
S21E03

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:

S21E02

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
programme.desc: Faded television actor Rick Dalton and his stunt double Cliff Booth strive to hang on to their careers during the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. As they navigate a changing film industry they barely recognise any more, they are drawn into the orbit of both ill-fated rising star Sharon Tate, and Charles Manson and his cult of zealous followers. Drama from director Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie, Timothy Olyphant and Al Pacino

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc:
Cape Feare: Psychotic Sideshow Bob is released from Springfield Penitentiary thirsting for revenge - prompting Bart and the rest of the family to join the witness protection programme. Featuring the guest voice of Kelsey Grammer
S05E02

programme.title: The Time Being (2012)
programme.desc: A struggling artist pursues his dreams at the expense of his family's lives. A wealthy eccentric seemingly provides a lifeline by offering him a commission for his work, but as his encounters with his new benefactor grow more unusual, he is forced to reconcile his personal ambitions with his responsibilities. Drama, starring Frank Langella and Wes Bentley

programme.title: Ghost Writer (2007)
programme.desc: A composer takes in a penniless writer, but when he realises his kindness is being cruelly exploited, he kills his guest in a fit of rage. To make up for his crime, he arranges to have the dead author's last work posthumously published - but when he takes credit for the work, his victim's spirit returns to haunt him. Black comedy, directed by and starring Alan Cumming. With David Boreanaz and Anne Heche

programme.desc: A blind novelist begins a passionate affair with the neglected wife of a corrupt businessman. Romantic drama, starring Alec Baldwin, Demi Moore and Dylan McDermott

programme.desc: An ageing wrestler who was a big star in the 1980s is now long past his prime. programme.title: The Heist (2009)
programme.desc: Roger, a security guard working at an American museum, discovers several pieces from a collection he has defended for more than a decade are due to be sold to a gallery in Denmark. Chief among them is The Lonely Maiden, a painting he has grown to adore during his years of service. Determined to stop the sale from taking place, he enlists the aid of two like-minded guards in a desperate mission to steal the artworks they have come to love. Crime comedy, starring Christopher Walken, Morgan Freeman and William H Macy

programme.desc: Freddie Steinmark is an underdog American footballer who battles personal problems to become a University of Texas legend. Sporting biopic, starring Aaron Eckhart, Finn Wittrock and Robin Tunney

programme.title: The Founder (2016)
programme.desc: Salesman Ray Kroc attempts to turn two brothers' innovative fast food eatery into the biggest restaurant business in the world. Drama, starring Michael Keaton, Nick Offerman and John Carroll Lynch

programme.title: Trumbo (2015)
programme.desc: Biopic of the acclaimed Hollywood screenwriter Dalton Trumbo, who was jailed and blacklisted in the 1940s for his left-wing political views. On his release from prison, he manages to continue writing using a series of pseudonyms, and his newfound success leads many to question the validity of the blacklist. Biopic of the writer, starring Bryan Cranston, Diane Lane and Helen Mirren

programme.title: Driven (2018)
programme.desc: The meteoric rise of the golden boy of the automotive industry, John DeLorean, and his iconic DeLorean Motor Company, told through the eyes of his friendship with charming, ex-con pilot-turned-FBI informant Jim Hoffman, which ultimately leads to his downfall. Drama, starring Jason Sudeikis and Lee Pace

programme.title: Walking Out (2017)
programme.desc: An urban teenager journeys to Montana to hunt big game with his estranged father. The duo struggle to connect, until a brutal encounter in the wilderness changes everything. Adventure, starring Matt Bomer, Josh Wiggins and Bill Pullman

programme.desc: Anthology of chilling tales by Stephen King, comprising the stories of a man who gets more than he bargained for when he employs a sinister agency to help him give up smoking, a gambler who sets his wife's lover a deadly challenge and a girl terrorised by a troll living in her bedroom wall. Drew Barrymore, James Woods, Robert Hays and Candy Clark star
